description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-6509 is a use-after-free vulnerability found in the Chromium open-source software, which is also utilized by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw arises when a program frees a block of memory while it is still being used, potentially leading to unexpected behavior, memory corruption, or security breaches. The specific version of the impacted Chromium variant affecting Microsoft Edge is 120.0.2210.61, which can allow for such misuse. Users are encouraged to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge to eliminate this vulnerability and ensure the security of their browsing experience. The associated knowledge base article is KB-120.0.2210.61.
